image.title: Julie: The Unwinding of the Miracle

itunes.summary: Julie Yip-Williams tried to stay as present and honest as possible as she watched herself die from Stage IV colon cancer. The series chronicles her process of preparing for her death and revisiting the events of her extraordinary life, through hours of intensely personal and revealing conversations. It is an immigrant story, a love story, and a ghost story. This series is a companion to her posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House on Feb 5th.
itunes.author: Pineapple Street Studios

title: Julie: The Unwinding of the Miracle

itunes.summary:
“Hi, Julie.”
This series is a companion to Julie Yip-Williams’ posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House.
Artwork by Dadu Shin.
If Julie’s story resonates with you, leave us a voicemail at (802) 347-3879.

itunes.summary:
"I couldn't watch myself be born, but I can watch myself die."
Julie: The Unwinding of the Miracle begins on January 25th.
This series is a companion to her posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
